titleInfo.title: Letter, J.G.M. Ramsey in Knoxville, Tenn., to Mrs. Elizabeth Ramsey Breck in Atlanta, Ga. 1871 Dec. 20

mods.abstract: J. G. M. Ramsey wrote to his daughter Elizabeth Alexander Ramsey Breck (Liddy) on December 20, 1871. He told her about his recent travels and mentioned about her travel. He updated her about her mother and siblings. He mentioned Sue's bond and that he could help Liddy rent her house and lot. He told her that McKnitt could probably find work if he came to Knoxville. He mentioned times being hard. He also mentioned that it had snowed and was very cold.

name.namePart: Ramsey, J. G. M. (James Gettys McGready), 1797-1884

subject.topic: Ramsey, J. G. M. (James Gettys McGready), 1797-1884 -- Correspondence
Breck, E. A. R. (Elizabeth Alexander Ramsey), 1823- -- Correspondence
